Merge branch 'master' into develop

Signed-off-by: Jan Philip Bernius <janphilip.bernius@tum.de>

Bump to 4.0.4

Signed-off-by: Jan Philip Bernius <janphilip.bernius@tum.de>
emit changes of unreferenced feedback to modeling exercises

Merge branch 'develop' into feature/assessment/feedback-for-missing-element

# Conflicts:
#	package.json
#	src/main/java/de/tum/in/www1/artemis/service/ProgrammingExerciseService.java
#	src/main/webapp/app/assessment/assessment-shared.module.ts

#	src/main/webapp/app/exercises/text/assess-new/text-submission-assessment.component.ts
#	yarn.lock
add unreferenced feedback for modeling exercises assessment
remove filtering of unreferenced feedback from modeling assessment API
filter unreferenced feedback from the feedback array sent to apollon
when finding the general feedback filter check that it is not unreferenced feedback
show unreferenced feedback in students result view
get all unreferenced feedback for the student result view text exercises and add correct translation for "Feedback for missing Elements"
compute total score in modeling-assessment-editor.component.html instead of modeling-assessment.component.ts
emit change when removing an unreferenced feedback
adjust test cases to test the unreferenced feedbacks

timeline.bodyText: Could you remove the whole method since it doesn't have a purpose anymore?
timeline.author: madwau

timeline.bodyText: feedbackElement.reference == null should be redundant here, since FeedbackType.MANUAL_UNREFERENCED already implies that, right?
timeline.author: madwau

timeline.bodyText:
The method calculateTotalScore could be shortened to:
this.totalScore = (this.feedback || []).reduce((totalScore, feedback) => totalScore + feedback.credits!)
timeline.author: madwau

replies.author: HanyaElhashemy

replies.bodyText: I didn't actually test it. Looks like it works if the initial value is set to 0:
replies.author: madwau

timeline.bodyText: This case is already covered by the following if statement.
timeline.author: madwau

timeline.message: apply eist tutors feedback regarding the result UI
adjust if condition for general feedback to check if it not unreferenced feedback

timeline.bodyText: Should we rather show a box for each element?
timeline.author: jpbernius
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -61,7 +61,18 @@
- +
+ +   + Feedback for Missing Elements: +
+

replies.bodyText: I am open to that! I did not put much thinking in the UI to be honest and just followed the general feedback style to keep the view looking consistent but if we go for a different style for unreferenced feedback then I don't mind and can adjust the code accordingly ^^
replies.author: HanyaElhashemy
HanyaElhashemy

replies.bodyText:
For text exercises, we do not have such a table, so this would be a new element. So I would follow this "alert style" boxes to keep it consistent. Maybe we can tinker with the margins to make it more space-efficient if this is a concern.
For modeling, maybe this is an option as the interface is different here.
But I see how we want to have one UI for this only.

Should we move this to a follow-up? I feel like shipping this in its current form is an improvement, but we should follow up quickly with a new version.
replies.author: jpbernius
